The pending Supreme Court case: Texas v. Azar, in which the Trump administration argues that the Affordable Care Act (ACA) should be struck down.
The White House: s refusal to provide a special open enrollment period for the ACA health exchanges during the coronavirus pandemic.
The Republican Party: s longstanding opposition to the ACA and their pursuit of an agenda to dismantle the law's preexisting condition protections.
The argument made by Republican states: attorneys general that without the penalty for not having health insurance, the rest of the ACA doesn't work and should be invalidated.
